msContents.summary: This is a mansucript of Nirukta. On the first page of the mansucript is written Gālavaniruktam in the granth script. After 43v there is a paper note by V Raghavan stating that folio are mixed. The colophon on 39v says iti gālava nirukte ṣaṣṭho .. yet it is not the end of the chapter. Content from 40r onwards is part of 6th chapter of the Nirukta according to the text available on GRETIL. 45v has colophon stating end of the 8th chapter. It demonstrates that each chapter appears to have its own foliation, and the manuscript has lost the middle folio.(http://gretil.sub.uni-goettingen.de/gretil/1_sanskr/1_veda/5_vedang/3_pratis/niruktau.htm). The existing editions of the Nirukta mention about the loss of the text of the Nirukta by Gālavamuni. But this manuscript mentions author as Gālavamuni, It ends at the chapter 8 where as the Nirukta by Yāskācārya has 14 chapters. The hand writing on some initial folio is different so it seems that it was written by two different people. Manuscript needs further attention for more details. New Catalogus Catalogorum and Aufrecht have entry of Nirukta of Yāskācārya but no manuscript with Gālavamuni is recorded. On 1r something is written in Granth script. there are three lines. 1r 1 (tyaṃ)? tāpyate lopo bhavati . gatvā gata? bhakti ssantamaye dityathākhyu … 1r 3 …. jhe ti ta tyatra ssava . vādanutarāṃ tasthānta ? bhavati na dvi prakṛtitāṃ sthānamiti .
